0.description: Lectures build on prescribed readings which students are expected to read before attending class.
0.name: Lecture (on campus)

2.description: A shared discovery opportunity for the student to work through prescribed exercises with a teacher present.
2.name: Workshop

3.description: Online lecture resources to watch each week.
3.name: Lecture (online)

0.description: A number of exams spread through the semester. Students will have the opportunity to repeat any exam to improve their mark.
0.title: Module Exams

1.description: Students are required to complete three coding exercises during the term
1.title: Coding Exercises

2.description: A semester-long programming task where students put all their skills to work creating a game or demo.
2.title: Major Creative Work

3.description: Examination assessing material from the Variables and Conditions module. Offered three time with highest mark counting towards final grade.
3.title: Variables and Conditions Exam

4.description: Examination assessing material from the Loops module. Offered three times with the highest mark counting towards final grade.
4.title: Loops Exam

5.description: Students are required to complete a combination of problem solving and short-answer questions.
5.title: Assignment 1

6.description: Examination assessing material from the Functions module. Offered three times with the highest mark counting towards final grade.
6.title: Functions Exam

7.description: Examination assessing material from the Compound Data module. Offered three times with the highest mark counting towards the final grade.
7.title: Compound Data Exam

8.description: Students are required to complete four module examinations on Variables and Conditionals, Loops, Functions and Compound Data. The exams are conducted online during lessons.
8.title: Module Exams

9.description: Examination assessing material from the Program Design and Problem Solving module. Offered two times with the highest mark counting towards the final grade.
9.title: Program Design and Problem Solving Exam

10.description: Students are required to complete a programming exercise that is designed to begin building competency in using a Processing language to solve problems.
10.title: Assignment 2

11.description: Examination assessing material from the Foundations of Programming module. Offered twice with highest mark counting towards final grade.
11.title: Foundations of Programming Exam

12.description: Students are required to complete an advanced programming task.
12.title: Assignment 3

COMP1000.description: This unit is an introductory computer science unit, providing a practical introduction to basic computing and programming concepts. Students gain an understanding of, and practical experience in, computer programming; practical experience in implementing informal prose descriptions of problem solutions using an imperative language; an understanding of, and practical experience in, designing, coding, testing and debugging simple algorithms; and an understanding of the principle of incremental development. Other topics include: the concept of program correctness; the differences between high-level languages, assembly languages and machine languages; the role played by compilers; and the execution of programs by computer hardware.

outcomes.ULO1: apply problem solving skills to develop algorithms that solve small to medium-sized computational problems
outcomes.ULO2: design and write code to implement a program description in an imperative programming language
outcomes.ULO3: use standard software engineering practices to document, debug and test their programs
outcomes.ULO4: understand and apply appropriately the concepts of variables, loops, functions, conditionals and compound data in the implementation of programmed systems
outcomes.ULO5: identify and describe ethical issues in an academic environment and demonstrate active engagement in the learning process

COMP1000.title: Introduction to Computer Programming
